newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela labor reform cost totals $14 bln - Matos.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela labor reform cost totals $14 bln - Matos.

text.p: The total government cost of recent Venezuelan labor reforms, including pension increases and public sector pay rises, is around 6.9 trillion bolivars ($14.4 billion), Finance Minister Luis Raul Matos Azocar said.

"We're talking about four trillion bolivars just for the payment of accumulated public sector severance payments," Matos told reporters after a ceremonial signing by President Rafael Caldera of the ground-breaking Labor Law reform bill.
On top of that, however, there are "another 1.5 trillion bolivars for pension payments and around 1.4 trillion for public sector pay rises."
With the signing of the Labor reform bill, both the government and private sector are required to pay the total of their employee's accumulated back severance pay within the next five years.
